item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "On the death of a friend, we should consider that the fates through confidence have devolved on us the task of a double living, that we have henceforth to fulfill the promise of our friend's life also, in our own, to the world." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every woman is a rebel." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Work is the curse of the drinking classes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Consistency is the hallmark of the unimaginative." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?" -- Scott Adams

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is too short to learn German" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "Dance like it hurts. Love like you need money. Work when people are watching. -- Dogbert's Motto" -- Scott Adams

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Podesta
item.description: "Public access to government information is a fundamental prerequisite to a functioning democracy. A democratic system is based on the notion that government legitimacy requires the consent of the governed. To be meaningful that consent must be informed." -- John Podesta

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Podesta
item.description: "Senator Kerry carries shrapnel in his thigh, as distinct from President Bush, who carries two fillings in his teeth from his service in the Alabama National Guard, which seems to be his only time that he showed up." -- John Podesta

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Religion. It's given people hope in a world torn apart by religion." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "At the age of eleven or thereabouts women acquire a poise and an ability to handle difficult situations which a man, if he is lucky, manages to achieve somewhere in the later seventies." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "You have to remember that it is impossible to commit a crime while reading a book." -- John Waters

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "I would never want to live anywhere but Baltimore. You can look far and wide, but you'll never discover a stranger city with such extreme style. It's as if every eccentric in the South decided to move north, ran out of gas in Baltimore, and decided to stay." -- John Waters

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "My hobby is extreme Catholic behavior -- BEFORE the Reformation." -- John Waters

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description:
"Thomas Jefferson once said: 'Of course the people don't want war. But the people can be brought to the bidding of their leader. All you have to do is tell them they're being attacked and denounce the pacifists for somehow a lack of patriotism and exposing the country to danger. It works the same in any country.' I think that was Jefferson. Oh wait. That was Hermann Goering. Shoot."
[Hosting the Peabody Awards for broadcasting excellence at the New York Waldorf-Astoria, June 6, 2006]" -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Donald Rumsfeld. Love him or hate him, you've gotta admit: a lot of people hate him." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "It's a no-win argument - that business of what we're born with and what our environment does to us. And it's a boring argument, because it simplifies the mysteries that attend both our birth and our growth." -- John Irving

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Logic is relative." -- John Irving

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "it's not god who's fucked up, it's the screamers who say they believe in him and who claim to pursue their ends in his holy name." -- John Irving

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "When you're drowning you don't think, <i>I would be incredibly pleased if someone would notice I'm drowning and come and rescue me.</I> You just scream." -- John Lennon

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by David Sheff
item.description: "In his suicide note, Kurt Cobain wrote, "It's better to burn out than to fade away." He was quoting a Neil Young song about Johnny Rotten of the Sex Pistols. When I was twenty-four, I interviewed John Lennon. I asked him about this sentiment, one that pervades rock and roll. He took strong, outraged exception to it. "It's better to fade away like an old soldier than to burn out, " he said. "I worship people who survive. I'll take the living and the healthy." -- David Sheff

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jimmy Carter
item.description: "Put on a sweater." -- Jimmy Carter

item.title: Baltimoregal add a quote by Jimmy Carter
item.description: "America did not invent human rights. In a very real senseâ€¦ human rights invented America." -- Jimmy Carter
